tit.e: Goma-dofu (crushed sesame seeds boiled in water and chilled like tofu)
tit.cmt: 後段で詳しく説明していますので括弧内説明は不要です。

sen.j: 胡麻豆腐（ごまどうふ）は精進料理のひとつ。
sen.e: Goma-dofu is one of Shojin-ryori (vegetarian diet).
Goma-dofu is one of Shojin-ryori (vegetarian diet).

sen.j: また奈良県および和歌山県の郷土料理でもある。
sen.e: It is also a local dish of Nara Prefecture and Wakayama Prefecture.
It is also a local dish of Nara Prefecture and Wakayama Prefecture.

sen.j: 「豆腐」の名称であるものの、原材料にはダイズは使用されていない。
sen.e: Although its name is 'tofu', soybeans are not used for its ingredients.
Although its name is 'tofu', soybean is not used as its ingredient.
sen.cmt: 材料の一つと考えます。

sen.j: 主な原材料は、皮をとり、すりつぶしたゴマ（あたり胡麻）および葛粉である。
sen.e: Principal ingredients are sesame seeds with its skin peeled off then grinded (Atari goma) (sesame paste), and kuzu starch (arrowroot starch).

sen.j: それらを水で溶いて火にかけ、型に入れて冷まして作る。
sen.e: These ingredients are dissolved in water, heated, then cooled after putting into a mold.

sen.j: 通常はそのまま冷奴として食べる。
sen.e: It is normally eaten as cold tofu.
It is normally eaten as hiya yakko (cold tofu, blocks of tofu served cold).
sen.cmt: OK。「ひややっこ」の読みと説明を加えます。
sen.e: It is normally eaten as hiya yakko (cold tofu, blocks of tofu served cold).

sen.j: 一般的には、デパート、スーパーマーケット、吉野地方・高野山などの土産店、道の駅などで販売されている。
sen.e: Generally, it is sold in department stores, supermarkets, souvenir shops and Michi no Eki (a roadside rest area with a market of local products for tourists) of Yoshino areas, Koyasan and so on.
Generally, it is sold in department stores, supermarkets, souvenir shops and Michi no Eki (a roadside rest area with a market of local products for tourists) in Yoshino area, Mt. Koya and so on.

sen.j: また宿坊を備えた禅寺院などの食事では、必ずと言ってもよい程供される定番の品目である。
sen.e: It is the standard dish to be served almost always in the meals of Zen-jin (temple for dhyana (profound meditation)) with shukubo (visitors' or pilgrims' lodgings in a temple).
It is a standard dish served as Shojin-ryori in almost all Zen temples operating shukubo (visitors' or pilgrims' lodgings in a temple).
sen.cmt: 文法ミスがあります。「禅」についての記事ではなくzenで通じるので説明をはぶきます。
sen.e: It is a standard dish served as Shojin-ryori in almost all Zen temples operating shukubo (visitors' or pilgrims' lodgings in a temple).

sen.j: 胡麻を主原料としており油分を多く含む為、口腔をさっぱりさせながら食べられるよう、ワサビ醤油で食べる事が多い。
sen.e: Because its principal ingredient is sesame seeds, it is rich in oil, and is eaten with soy sauce mixed with wasabi paste so as to keep light taste inside the mouth.
Since it is oily for the principal ingredient, sesame, it is eaten often with soy sauce mixed with wasabi (paste of green Japanese horseradish) so as to keep mouth fresh.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: Since it is oily for the principal ingredient, sesame, it is eaten often with soy sauce mixed with wasabi (paste of green Japanese horseradish) so as to keep mouth fresh.

sen.j: 胡麻を、舌触りが滑らかになるまで肌理細かく擂るのは大変に手間のかかる作業だが、家庭で作るならば市販の練りゴマを使い、葛粉は片栗粉（とはいえ大半はジャガイモでんぷんだが）で代用すればよい。
sen.e: It is a time-consuming job to grind the sesame seeds smoothly to create smooth feeling on the tongue, but if one were to make it at home, sesame pastes sold in stores may be used, and potato starch may be used instead of kudzu starch.

It is a time-consuming job to grind the sesame seeds smoothly to create smooth feeling on the tongue, but if one were to make it at home, sesame pastes sold in stores may be used, and potato starch may be used instead of kudzu starch.

Grinding sesame seeds sufficiently to achieve a silky smooth, soft texture is time consuming, so for home-made goma-dofu, sesame pastes sold in stores can be used instead of grinding the sesame seeds yourself, and potato starch can be used instead of kuzu starch.
sen.cmt: smoothly to create smooth feeling on the tongue→to achieve a silky smooth, soft texturekudzu →kuzu

sen.j: 胡麻以外でも、クルミ、ラッカセイ、カシの果実等で同様の食品を作る事ができる。
sen.e: Other than sesame seeds, the same kind of tofu may be prepared by using walnuts, peanuts, acorn fruits and so on.

sen.j: とくに落花生のものは、沖縄県ではジーマーミ豆腐（じーまーみどうふ）と呼び、一般的な食品である。
sen.e: Especially, tofu made with peanuts is a common food in Okinawa called jimami-dofu.
Especially, tofu made with peanuts is a common food in Okinawa Prefecture and it is called 'jimami-dofu.'

sen.j: カシの実の豆腐は高知県で作られており、文禄・慶長の役の際に伝来したものとも言われる。
sen.e: Tofu made of acorns is made in Kochi Prefecture, and it is said to have been imported during the Bunroku-Keicho War.
